name: cfmail
description: Sends an email message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.

params.name: bcc
params.description: Email address(es) to which to copy the message, without listing them in the message header.

params.name: cc
params.description: Email address(es) to which to copy the message

params.name: charset
params.description: The character encoding in which the text part is encoded.

params.name: debug
params.description:
true: sends debugging output to standard output. By default, if the console window is unavailable, ColdFusion sends output to cf_root\runtime\logs\coldfusion-out.log on server configurations. On J2EE configurations, with JRun, the default location is jrun_home/logs/servername-out.log.
false: does not generate debugging output.

params.name: encrypt
params.description: CF11+ Toggles email message encryption

params.name: encryptionalgorithm
params.description:
CF11+ Algorithm to use when encrypt=true
Encryption support is provided through S/MIME.

params.name: failto
params.description: Email address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.

params.name: from
params.description: Message sender email address.

params.name: group
params.description: Query column to use when you group sets of records to send as a message. For example, to send a set of billing statements to a customer, group on "Customer_ID." Case-sensitive. Eliminates adjacent duplicates when data is sorted by the specified field.

params.name: groupcasesensitive
params.description: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.

params.name: keyalias
params.description: Alias of the key with which the certificate and private key is stored in keystore. If it is not specified then the first entry in the keystore will be picked up.

params.name: keypassword
params.description: Password with which the private key is stored. If it is not specified, keystorepassword will be used as keypassword as well.

params.name: keystore
params.description: Keystore containing the private key and certificate. The supported type is JKS (java key store) and pkcs12

params.name: keystorepassword
params.description: Password of the keystore

params.name: mailerid
params.description: Mailer ID to be passed in X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.

params.name: maxrows
params.description: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.

params.name: mimeattach
params.description: Path of file to attach to message. Attached file is MIME-encoded. CFML attempts to determine the MIME type of the file; use the cfmailparam tag to send an attachement and specify the MIME type.

params.name: password
params.description: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.

params.name: port
params.description: TCP/IP port on which SMTP server listens for requests (normally 25). A value here overrides the Administrator.

params.name: priority
params.description: The message priority level. Can be an integer in the range 1-5; 1 represents the highest priority, or one of the following string values, which correspond to the numeric values

params.name: query
params.description: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for message(s). Use this attribute to send more than one message, or to send query results within a message.

params.name: recipientcert
params.description: CF11+ Path to the public key certificate of the recipient.

params.name: remove
params.description: Tells ColdFusion to remove any attachments after successful mail delivery.

params.name: replyto
params.description: Email address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.

params.name: server
params.description: SMTP server address, or (Enterprise edition only) a comma-delimited list of server addresses, to use for sending messages. At least one server must be specified here or in the CFML MX Administrator. A value here overrides the Administrator. A value that includes a port specification overrides the port attribute.

params.name: sign
params.description: Mail will be signed when set to true

params.name: spoolenable
params.description: Specifies whether to spool mail or always send it Immediately. Overrides the CFML MX Administrator Spool mail messages to disk for delivery setting.

params.name: startrow
params.description: Row in a query to start from.

params.name: subject
params.description: Message subject. Can be dynamically generated.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.

params.name: to
params.description: Message recipient email addresses.

params.name: type
params.description: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type

params.name: username
params.description: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute

params.name: usessl
params.description: Whether to use Secure Sockets Layer.

params.name: usetls
params.description: Whether to use Transport Level Security.

params.name: wraptext
params.description: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

examples.title: Send basic email message
examples.description: The SMTP server details are provided through the Administrator.
examples.code:
<cfmail to="recipient@example.com" from="sender@example.com" subject="Example email">
  Your Email Message!!
</cfmail>

examples.title: Send basic email message overriding default SMTP server
examples.description: The SMTP server details are provided in code.
examples.code:
<cfmail to="recipient@example.com" from="sender@example.com" subject="Example email" server="smtp.example.com" port="25" username="myUsername" password="myPassword">
  Your Email Message!!
</cfmail>

examples.title: Send email messages using a query
examples.description: Loop through database records and sends one email per row.
examples.code:
<cfset myQuery = queryNew( "recipient,lastname,firstname" )>
<cfset queryAddRow( myQuery, { receipient = "receipient@example.com", lastname = "Doe", firstname = "John" }) />

<cfmail to="#recipient#" from="sender@example.com" subject="Example email" query="myQuery">
  Dear #lastname#,

  Text here, containing any variable in the myQuery scope.
</cfmail>

examples.title: Script syntax using new mail()
examples.description: CF9+ The cfmail features are also available through the mail component.

examples.title: Script syntax using function call
examples.description: CF11+ Send basic email using function call.
examples.code: cfmail( to = "recipient@example.com", from = "sender@example.com", subject = "Example email" ) { WriteOutput( "Your Email Message!!" ); }
